last_episode_to_air.name: Reconstruction
last_episode_to_air.overview: Explore the hope and resilience of the Black community throughout history, as well as the ability to turn pain into promise, prosperity and power.

name: Soul of a Nation
overview: A unique window into authentic realities of Black life and dive deeper into this critical moment of racial reckoning. Each episode explores a specific theme including spirituality, Black joy, activism in sports and the racial reckoning that erupted after George Floyd's death.

episodes.name: Reckonings
episodes.overview: Sterling K. Brown hosts a look at racial reckoning in present-day America, tackling issues ranging from policing to reparations and segments highlighting the arts and entertainment.

episodes.name: Next
episodes.overview: Actress Marsai Martin hosts a look at the next generation of Black Americans and their unique ability to trailblaze, innovate and live on the cutting-edge no matter what they have to overcome; H.E.R. performs.

episodes.name: Faith
episodes.overview: Learn the authentic realities of Black life by exploring specific themes, including spirituality, Black joy, activism in sports and the racial reckoning that erupted after George Floyd's death.

episodes.name: Black joy
episodes.overview: 2020 was the year humor became the best antidote to pain and loneliness. What is comedy's role within the Black community?

episodes.name: 'Shut up and...'
episodes.overview: Sports have played a historic role in America's current racial reckoning. Black athletes are provoking a seismic shift in this current moment.

episodes.name: Reconstruction
episodes.overview: Explore the hope and resilience of the Black community throughout history, as well as the ability to turn pain into promise, prosperity and power.
